channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: These stock-trading moves can boost your portfolio if the ‘Santa Claus rally’ fails
item.description: Despite year-end selling, market conditions look promising for 2025.

item.title: Do stock holdings reflect individual risk preferences or the growing use of target-date funds?
item.description: I suspected most financial assets were in 401(k) plans and most 401(k) holdings were directed by target-date funds, but the data told a somewhat diffe...

item.title: This investor imagined himself in 2035. He expects U.S. stocks to struggle.
item.description: It’s one thing to try to forecast a decade of returns, though many firms including JPMorgan and Vanguard regularly produce such forecasts.

item.title: My ex is sick but won’t retire to spite me out of benefits. He took our marriage and divorce papers, but can I get his Social Security benefits?
item.description: “I was married to my former husband for 11 years.”

item.title: The Stock Market Is Like a Fashion Show, and Here's One of Its Hot Must-Haves
item.description: Software companies are touting something called the “Rule of 40,” but some are more flash than substance.

item.title: European Natural Gas Prices Slip, But Stay Elevated Due to Cold Weather Forecasts
item.description: European natural gas prices fell in volatile trading amid colder-than-average weather forecasts for the next two weeks.

item.title: Tesla's Car Business Isn't Really in the Driver's Seat
item.description: The majority of EV maker’s market cap rides on hope for robotaxis, robots and AI, but the stock is now at a sharp premium even compared with other tec...

item.title: Stock Futures Tick Higher While U.S. Steel Stock Drops
item.description: Stock futures edged higher, led by a rebound in Tesla and chip stocks, while overseas markets were mixed.

item.title: Mortgage rates inch up to start the year at a near six-month high. Will the housing market become more affordable in 2025?
item.description: The 30-year mortgage rate averaged at 6.91%, Freddie Mac said in its latest weekly survey on Thursday.

item.title: Dollar Falls Are Likely to Be Short-Lived
item.description: The dollar edged down against a basket of currencies in early trade and ING said it could continue to fall modestly once liquidity is fully re-establi...
